ghostPost.title: What colour is your yak? Visualizing developer jargon
ghostPost.excerpt: We've created some fun illustrations around software dev jargon. Help us pick which ones we should work on next.
ghostPost.custom_excerpt: We've created some fun illustrations around software dev jargon. Help us pick which ones we should work on next.

authors.name: FISSION Team
authors.bio: Exploring fundamental shifts in the way we host, deploy, and run software for humans, using decentralized web technologies.

ghostPost.plaintext:
We're creating illustrations for developer concepts, catch phrases, and other
jargon. Yak shaving  is one of those terms. It's fun to dig into the concepts
and learn about their background, teach other people about them, and we get some
cool images to use in a number of different ways that aren't just company
branding. We have ideas for some new illustrations, we're happy to take other
suggestions and have people vote for their favourites
[https://talk.fission.codes/t/vote-for-and-suggest-developer-concepts-to-illustrate/590]
.

Bear and Penguin
We had fun last year sourcing the Bear and Penguin illustration for the Berlin
Open Source Salon [https://blog.fission.codes/bear-penguin-bounty-for-boss/].
The inner meaning here is that the bear is the coat of arms for the city of
Berlin – the "Berliner Bär". The bear is holding a Club Mate drink, traditional
drink of German hackers (although I know at one time the Mozilla Vancouver team
imported it for their office fridge, too!). And the penguin is the long time
mascot of Linux.

Wizards and Snakes
Since then, we've worked with Bruno Monts [https://www.behance.net/brunomonts],
an illustrator based in Brasil, to create a number of other illustrations.

We just released the Haskell Wizards  series, written up in our Haskell for
Typescript Devs book
[https://haskellfortypescriptdevs.fission.codes/appendix/haskell-wizards]:

SCREAMING SNAKE CASE [https://blog.fission.codes/screaming-snake-case/]  was
just a pure piece of fun, with the vaporwave stylings pushed to the max. We did
a first run of stickers with this image, and can't wait to come up with t-shirts
or other swag with this fun image:

Vote for developer jargon to illustrate
We're going to get some more illustrations made, and have a couple of ideas
already:

 1. Kebab case  wouldn't be vaporwave, but maybe a sort of comic / graphic art –
    a delicious kebab, dripping sauce.
 2. The Elm programming language  is a favourite of ours at Fission, so vote for
    this one if you want an Elm-y character in the style of the Haskell Wizards
 3. We recently added some definitions for Yak shaving to our forum
    [https://talk.fission.codes/t/yak-shaving-programming-term/582]. It's only
    about 20 years old – but of course software development has changed
    dramatically in the last 20 years, so it's a term that's not well known.
 4. Bike shedding  and
 5. Pets vs. Cattle are the last two suggestions we have so far.

Read more about these ideas, vote in the forum for your favourites to get
illustrated, or suggest your own »
[https://talk.fission.codes/t/vote-for-and-suggest-developer-concepts-to-illustrate/590]

We're working with Bruno now, and will run the vote for a couple of weeks, and
then get at least 2 or 3 of the developer jargon ideas turned into high quality
illustrations.

Post header photo by Lieve Ransijn
[https://unsplash.com/@lievemax?utm_source=unsplash&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=creditCopyText] 
 on Unsplash
[https://unsplash.com/s/photos/yak?utm_source=unsplash&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=creditCopyText]
ghostPost.html:
We're creating illustrations for developer concepts, catch phrases, and other jargon. Yak shaving is one of those terms. It's fun to dig into the concepts and learn about their background, teach other people about them, and we get some cool images to use in a number of different ways that aren't just company branding. We have ideas for some new illustrations, we're happy to take other suggestions and have people vote for their favourites.

Bear and Penguin

We had fun last year sourcing the Bear and Penguin illustration for the Berlin Open Source Salon. The inner meaning here is that the bear is the coat of arms for the city of Berlin – the "Berliner Bär". The bear is holding a Club Mate drink, traditional drink of German hackers (although I know at one time the Mozilla Vancouver team imported it for their office fridge, too!). And the penguin is the long time mascot of Linux.

Wizards and Snakes

Since then, we've worked with Bruno Monts, an illustrator based in Brasil, to create a number of other illustrations.

We just released the Haskell Wizards series, written up in our Haskell for Typescript Devs book:

SCREAMING SNAKE CASE was just a pure piece of fun, with the vaporwave stylings pushed to the max. We did a first run of stickers with this image, and can't wait to come up with t-shirts or other swag with this fun image:

Vote for developer jargon to illustrate

We're going to get some more illustrations made, and have a couple of ideas already:

  1. Kebab case wouldn't be vaporwave, but maybe a sort of comic / graphic art – a delicious kebab, dripping sauce.
  2. The Elm programming language is a favourite of ours at Fission, so vote for this one if you want an Elm-y character in the style of the Haskell Wizards
  3. We recently added some definitions for Yak shaving to our forum. It's only about 20 years old – but of course software development has changed dramatically in the last 20 years, so it's a term that's not well known.
  4. Bike shedding and
  5. Pets vs. Cattle are the last two suggestions we have so far.

Read more about these ideas, vote in the forum for your favourites to get illustrated, or suggest your own »

We're working with Bruno now, and will run the vote for a couple of weeks, and then get at least 2 or 3 of the developer jargon ideas turned into high quality illustrations.

Post header photo by Lieve Ransijn on Unsplash
